content:
If one end of a single polypeptide chain has an amino group exposed,
what functional group is typically exposed at the opposite end?
subject: BIOLOGY

content: What is the most common name of the protein that synthesizes DNA?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following compounds is used as a fuel additive in
what is commonly known as “dry-gas” by solubilizing water to reduce its contamination in gasoline:
W) isooctane
X) glycerol
Y) MTBE
Z) isopropyl alcohol
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
The molar heat of vaporization for water at its boiling point and
in kilojoules per mole is:
W) 6.01
X) 40.7
Y) 540
Z) 2,260
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Consider an electric charge moving through a magnetic field. A
force acts on the charge perpendicular to the direction of the charge’s motion and direction of the
magnetic field. Which of the following is the MOST common name for this force:
W) B field
X) Lorentz force
Y) electrodynamic force
Z) Faraday force
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following BEST describes the Lorentz Contraction:
W) reduction in the mass of a body as it approaches the speed of light
X) reduction in the length of a body along the direction of motion as it approaches the speed of light
Y) loss of kinetic energy when any object slows
Z) loss of potential energy when any body emits electromagnetic radiation
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) REDUCTION IN THE LENGTH OF A BODY ALONG THE DIRECTION OFMOTION AS IT APPROACHES THE SPEED OF LIGHT

content:
What is the determinant of a 2-by-2 square matrix whose rows are 4, 2
and –3, –4?
subject: MATH

content:
Solve the following equation for x: –2|3 + ( )| = –10 (read as: negative
2
2 times the absolute value of 3 plus, open parenthesis, x divided by 2, close parenthesis, close
absolute value, equals negative 10)
subject: MATH

content:
What is the most common name for the temperature-slope or
depth interval over which temperature changes with depth in a lake?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Trilobites are index fossils that lived:
W) in warm, ocean waters
X) during the Achaean geological time
Y) in desert environments
Z) in lakes, rivers and streams
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
The Chesapeake Bay Foundation has enlisted the help
of volunteers to raise oysters within cages tied to docks just below the water’s surface. Which of the
following is the BEST reason why these amateur conservationists will not be tempted to eat their
oysters:
W) they are genetically engineered and their impact on human heath has not been assessed
X) they were irradiated prior to seeding to ensure they were disease-free
Y) there is a water pollution advisory against eating oysters grown within most of the watershed
Z) some are equipped with a radio transmitter to allow biologists to easily measure population
changes
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Y) THERE IS A WATER POLLUTION ADVISORY AGAINST EATING OYSTERSGROWN WITHIN MOST OF THE WATERSHED

content:
If one of Earth’s tectonic plates moves at a rate of about 10
centimeters per year, how many kilometers will it move in 100 million years?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: 10,000(Solution: 10 cm/yr = 1 × 10-4 Km/yr (100,000,000 yr) = 10,000 Km)High School Round 7 Page 3

content:
From data primarily on the motions of what planet did Kepler
propose that planets follow elliptical orbits?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
What object in the night sky can reach a maximum apparent
magnitude of negative 12.6?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: What is the main respiratory pigment of skeletal muscle cells?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Choosing from primary through quaternary, what level of protein
structure is conferred by a beta pleated sheet?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
An increase in which of the following conditions would NOT
lead to an increase in pressure of a gas in a piston:
W) increased temperature
X) increased number of gas molecules
Y) increased average kinetic energy of gas particles
Z) increased volume
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
To the nearest whole number, how many grams of Na SO , whose
2 4
formula weight is 142, are needed to prepare a 500 milliliter 0.100 molar solution?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following best describes the concept upon which
Kirchhoff’s current law or first law is based:
W) charges come in unit dimensions
X) all charges flow from the negative to the positive
Y) charge can neither be created nor destroyed
Z) what goes up must come down
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Y) CHARGE CAN NEITHER BE CREATED NOR DESTROYED

content:
Give by name or number all of the following 4 choices that would be
considered units of electrical power: 1) ampere volt; 2) joules per second; 3) watts; 4) coulombs
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Giving your answer as up, down, left, or right, the graph of the equation
x = 5y – 8y2 – 1 opens in what direction?
subject: MATH

content:
If $10,000 is placed in a savings account that pays 5% interest
compounded annually, what is the total amount of money in the account at the end of 2 years, to the
nearest dollar?
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following atmospheric gases is created
naturally by the action of sunlight on molecular oxygen:
W) ozone
X) carbon monoxide
Y) nitrous oxide
Z) methane
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
On a weather map, what type of frontal boundary is
represented by alternating blue and red lines with blue triangles pointing toward the warmer air and
red semicircles pointing toward the colder air?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: STATIONARY (ACCEPT: STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY orSTATIONARY FRONT)High School Round 7 Page 6

content:
Geothermal power plants use which of the following to
generate electricity:
W) coal
X) steam
Y) sunlight
Z) pressurized water
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Diatoms are:
W) bacteria
X) twinned crystals
Y) seaweed
Z) algae
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following statements is LEAST accurate:
W) solar eclipses are less common than lunar eclipses
X) stars that begin their lives with greater mass have longer life-spans
Y) stars in the same constellation are not necessarily at the same distance from Earth
Z) M-31 is a galaxy
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: X) STARS THAT BEGIN THEIR LIVES WITH GREATER MASS HAVE LONGERLIFE-SPANS

content:
In what constellation is the brightest-appearing star in the night
sky?
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: CANIS MAJOR(Solution: Alpha Canis Majoris, also called Sirius, is in Canis Major and is the brightest star in thesky)High School Round 7 Page 7

content:
What specific biological process is believed to have produced most
of the diatomic oxygen in the Earth’s atmosphere?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
In photosynthesis II (read as: two), what is light energy most notably
used to initially accomplish?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
According to VSEPR bonding theory, what type of geometry
does a molecule have when the central atom is surrounded by 4 bonded groups, such as in methane?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following is considered a weak acid:
W) HCO H
2
X) HClO
4
Y) HNO
3
Z) HBr
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: W) HCO H2High School Round 7 Page 8

content:
What is the MOST common name for the electrical device often made
of two parallel conducting plates separated by a paper insulator all rolled into a cylinder to function
in storing electrical energy?
subject: PHYSICS

content: What is the SI unit of capacitance equal to one coulomb per volt?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
In what quadrant does θ (read as: theta) terminate if sine θ is positive and
secant θ is negative?

1 1
x2 − x−1=0
8 4

content:
Which of the following rocks is MOST porous:
W) marble
X) granite
Y) limestone
Z) slate
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
If the intent is to neutralize soil acidity, the mixing of
which of the following materials in the soil would be the LEAST effective:
W) ground limestone
X) ground oyster shells
Y) pure CaCO
3
Z) gypsum
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is used as a white pigment in
paint, paper, and plastics:
W) Teflon
X) zeolites
Y) titanium dioxide
Z) diatomaceous earth
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Cats have a special layer of tissue behind their retina
called the tapetum lucidum that does which of the following:
W) reflects back to the retina stray photons of light
X) allows for color vision
Y) allows only for black, white and grey vision
Z) serves as a second eyelid to protect the eye
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) REFLECTS BACK TO THE RETINA STRAY PHOTONS OF LIGHTHigh School Round 7 Page 10

content:
What basic force is responsible for forming the liquid-metallic
hydrogen layer on the planet Jupiter?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
During what month is the average surface temperature of the
Earth typically the highest?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
In what specific part of the testes does spermatogenesis occur in
mammals?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What human gland, which is mostly lymphoid tissue, is critical to the
normal development of cell mediated immunity and, if removed after young adulthood, seems to
have no ill effects on the immune system?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
When a strip of sodium reacts with dilute HCl, what gas is
produced?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
The release of hydrogen gas in the above experiment is called:
W) combustion
X) effervescence
Y) diffusion
Z) ebullition
subject: CHEMISTRY

content: What was the electrolyte used in the first voltaic piles built by Volta?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What is the resistance, giving your answer in standard SI units, of an
electric device operating on a 9-volt battery that requires 0.05 amps to run?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 180 OHMS(Solution: R = V/I = 9/0.05 = 180 ohms)High School Round 7 Page 12

content:
What is the most common name for the micro-gametophyte in
flowering plants?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Sieve cells and sieve tube members are types of what specific
conductive plant cell type?
subject: BIOLOGY
